extendedIngredients.name: mint leaves
extendedIngredients.originalString: 3 coriander or mint leaves for garnish

extendedIngredients.name: rock salt
extendedIngredients.originalString: a pinch of black salt or rock salt (add rock salt if making for fasting or vrat)

extendedIngredients.name: yogurt
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1.5 cups chilled yogurt, dairy or vegan

extendedIngredients.name: as required
extendedIngredients.originalString: a pinch of red chili powder or as required

recipes.title: pomegranate raita , how to make pomegranate raita

winePairing.pairingText: Raita works really well with Sparkling rosé and Sparkling Wine. If you're serving a selection of appetizers, you can't go wrong with these. Both are very food friendly and complement a variety of flavors. One wine you could try is Bellissima Sparkling rosé. It has 4.5 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 24 dollars.

productMatches.title: Bellissima Sparkling Rose
productMatches.description: This is an elegant, bright rosé, with hints of strawberry and grapefruit, and a soft, persistent foam. Uncorked at the very last minute, Bellissima Sparkling Rosé pairs perfectly with smoked salmon, shellfish, and seafood hor d’oeuvres such as tuna tartare, sushi, and sashimi.

recipes.instructions: whisk the yogurt till smooth.season with the spice powders, salt and and sugar.stir till sugar is dissolved.add the pomegranate arils and reserve a few for garnish.stir and pour the raita in serving bowls and garnish with the pomegranate pearls and coriander or mint leaves.you can also chill and serve the pomegranate raita later.

steps.step: whisk the yogurt till smooth.season with the spice powders, salt and and sugar.stir till sugar is dissolved.add the pomegranate arils and reserve a few for garnish.stir and pour the raita in serving bowls and garnish with the pomegranate pearls and coriander or mint leaves.you can also chill and serve the pomegranate raita later.
